headshotImage.longCaption: Yuvraj Singh headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Morne van Wyk c & b Yuvraj Singh 56 (63b 8x4 0x6 72m) SR: 88.88

dismissalComment.html: Yuvraj plucks an apple out of nowhere! The best part of the catch was how easy he made it look. Tossed up on off stump, van Wyk packs a punch in his straight drive, and thinks he can get it easily down the ground. Yuvraj seemed to say, "Talk to the hand". Left hand to be specific. He just puts the left hand out and holds a ball that was traveling at some pace. Easy does it.

headshotImage.caption: Munaf Patel player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Munaf Patel player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: JP Duminy headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: JP Duminy headshot

dismissalComment.html: and gone. Munaf hits back. He holds the length back and keeps it on off stump, JP looks to pull and skies a top edge. Munaf recovers well on his follow through, moves to the left of the pitch around the non-striker's end and takes the catch.

headshotImage.caption: F du Plessis headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: F du Plessis headshot

dismissalComment.html: Faf has been Munaf-ed. Adjusts his line, knowing that Faf will look for the off side again, ramrod straight, without drifting on to the pads. Faf charged out, but could not have played any proper shot to that one. He's tried to work it to the off side, but the ball slips past at 135.5 kph and middle stump is out of the ground.

headshotImage.caption: Johan Botha player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Johan Botha player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Munaf is throwing a humongous spanner in South Africa's works here. Another wicket goes down and this is exceptionally smart bowling. Barring the one ball that JP drove through the covers, there's been nothing to drive. This was another delivery back of a length in line with the stumps and Botha had to manufacture a shot. He looked to get forward, and then tried to force the pull, despite not having the room or the length for the shot. He got a top-edge, and Dhoni ran back to collect it.

headshotImage.caption: Zaheer Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Zaheer Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Yawn. Zaheer gets Smith. On a length outside off, perfect length from Zaheer. Smith - as has been the case so many times this summer - is not sure whether he should play back, or play forward. Or even play at it. He ends up hanging the bat outside the off stump without much conviction after getting half forward and gets a healthy edge that is heading to first slip. Until Yusuf at second slip moves quickly to his right and pouches it almost in front of Rohit's face at first.

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: and India have another one in the end overs. Zaheer delivers the inch-perfect yorker from over the stumps. It was always headed for the base of off stump. Robin backed away, made room and looked to squeeze it away through the off side, but there was no stopping this one. Off stump goes for a walk.

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers st †Dhoni b Yuvraj Singh 11 (12b 1x4 0x6 14m) SR: 91.66

dismissalComment.html: Yuvraj has made AB look rather ordinary with a lovely bit of spin. It's the same thing that happened in the previous game, though then, AB was wrongly given caught behind as he lunged out. This time he is comprehensively stumped,. Slow through the air, dipping on middle and leg, and breaking away menacingly. AB was lulled into skipping down the track, fooled by the flight, and was then groping in hope as it turned past him. Dhoni had a year to break the stumps.

dismissalText.commentary: Dale Steyn run out (†Dhoni) 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Steyn is run out. He chips out of the crease, making room on the off side as he does. Zaheer sees him and follows him, leaving Steyn with no room to play it to the off side. It is through him and Dhoni collects. Steyn tries to steal a single and turn the strike over to Amla, before realising there is no chance for a run. Dhoni runs towards the stumps and throws them down. Five down since resumption.

dismissalText.commentary: Morne Morkel run out (†Dhoni) 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: South Africa have lost the plot. And don't even seem to know it. Morne misses another yorker outside off, and then runs out of his crease mindlessly. Dhoni collects again and throws the stumps down. You miss, you run, I hit - seems to be the routine.

headshotImage.caption: Yusuf Pathan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Yusuf Pathan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: F du Plessis headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: F du Plessis headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Yusuf Pathan c du Plessis b Morkel 105 (70b 8x4 8x6 104m) SR: 150

dismissalComment.html: and it's over. Well. It was too good to last. Yusuf looks to rocket-launch it down the ground. And for once, he did not middle it. I think he got it low on the bat and scooped it straight up. Faf gets under the skier. Fittingly, Morne has got the wicket, which I think should clinch the game for SA. Yusuf knew it as soon as he made contact. He was in agony the moment the ball wen up. He was livid before it came down. He was in despair when it was caught. Never mind it, he is a hero.

headshotImage.caption: Parthiv Patel player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Parthiv Patel player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.longCaption: M Morkel headshot

headshotImage.caption: F du Plessis headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: F du Plessis headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Parthiv Patel c du Plessis b Morkel 38 (34b 6x4 0x6 52m) SR: 111.76

dismissalComment.html: du Plessis seems to have taken a very good catch at covers. But they are checking upstairs. This could be interesting. Here's what happened: Driving length again from Morne, Parthiv gives it the treatment with another cover drive, but this time it is slightly airy. Faf at cover dives across to his left, tries to take it with both hands, with the right hand over the left. As he lands, the left hand comes off after he pouched it, and his right hand took full control of the ball. Did the ball touch the ground as he landed? Replays seem a little dicey - he did have two fingers under the ball in the end. The third umpire gives it out. Parthiv's blinder comes to an end.

headshotImage.caption: M Morkel headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: M Morkel headshot

headshotImage.caption: V Kohli headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: V Kohli headshot

dismissalComment.html: A rare failure for Virat Kohli. Morne does him with sheer pace. Back of a length and extra bounce from outside off, Kohli committed to the check-drive into the covers early. On second thoughts, he may have wanted to leave it. It is through him in a jiffy, taking the outside edge through to the keeper

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: India have lost a huge wicket. The scorecard will say edged and caught at slip, but this was not an outside edge in the true sense of the word. It was short, fractionally outside off and Dhoni went for the cut. He was a little late on the shot, and it wasn't wide enough for the cut. Plus it bounced more than he anticipated. Hence the edge, it was dying on first slip who took it well. India are reeling here.

headshotImage.caption: Parthiv Patel player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: DW Steyn headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: DW Steyn headshot

headshotImage.caption: Yuvraj Singh headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Yuvraj Singh headshot

dismissalComment.html: Yuvraj plays one of the most ordinary shots you will see. Short, slower ball at 120 kph, lifting at him outside off, no room for the cut and Yuvraj goes at it with a half-hearted half-cut, half-steer nothing shot and guides it straight to point. It wasn't timed well enough to rush past the fielder, or placed wide enough to beat him. India's challenge is coming to an end.

headshotImage.caption: SK Raina headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: SK Raina headshot

dismissalComment.html: Oh, Raina. Another wicket gifted. Raina looks to upper cut over third man now. That was lifting outside off, and there was a deep third man in place. Raina couldn't have found the fielder with more precision if he was aiming for him. Well, at this rate, India might be bowled out before 20 overs. And yes, that will constitute a match!

dismissalText.commentary: Rohit Sharma b Tsotsobe 5 (8b 1x4 0x6 15m) SR: 62.5

dismissalComment.html: And Rohit falls. Frustrating, as he has been through this series. Lopsy angles another one across him and Rohit goes for another expansive cover drive. Unlike the previous shot, he does not move his feet across. The result - a thick inside edge that crashes into the stumps.

SA are five balls away from getting their hands on the prize. India can still make the early evening flight back home. Even South Africa can't choke from here.

dismissalText.commentary: Yusuf Pathan c du Plessis b Morkel 105 (70b 8x4 8x6 104m) SR: 150

dismissalComment.html: and it's over. Well. It was too good to last. Yusuf looks to rocket-launch it down the ground. And for once, he did not middle it. I think he got it low on the bat and scooped it straight up. Faf gets under the skier. Fittingly, Morne has got the wicket, which I think should clinch the game for SA. Yusuf knew it as soon as he made contact. He was in agony the moment the ball wen up. He was livid before it came down. He was in despair when it was caught. Never mind it, he is a hero.

dismissalComment.html: Could not have been more fitting. Morne Morkel has the last touch on the ball as the series closes. 3-2 to South Africa, who were the better team through the series. dismissalText.commentary: Zaheer Khan c Morkel b Tsotsobe 24 (58b 3x4 0x6 81m) SR: 41.37

commentTextItems.html: Could not have been more fitting. Morne Morkel has the last touch on the ball as the series closes. 3-2 to South Africa, who were the better team through the series. Back of a length from Lopsy, Zaheer tries to crack it over the off side, hits it too high and Morne gets under it as he runs to his left from long off.

commentPostTextItems.html: What an amazing tour we have had. Dead even in the Tests, India took the one-off T20, and SA have taken the ODIs after a scrap that went down to the wire. Lots of good cricket right through, it's been a privilege bringing you the action. Sid Ravindran's final bulletin is getting updated here, and we will have a lot of analysis and quotes from Sid Monga and Firdose Moonda later in the day. Until then, this is Nitin Sundar signing off on behalf of the team, after what's been a fantastic tour. So long, and thanks for all the fish.
Smith collects the silverware. The crowd erupts, and the party will go into the night in Centurion. And then, the World Cup focus shall resume.

Smith, in his last home series as South Africa ODI captain: "Terrific to sign out with the series. Wicket wasn't easy - we thought 250-260 was a really good total. Yusuf started to middle a few and almost took it away, but we held on. We weren't as aggressive as we wanted to be when Yusuf and Zaheer were going, but otherwise we were pretty good. We have a really good chance at the World Cup. India have handled themselves very well. The crowds have been special."

Man of the series, of which Sid Monga from ESPNcricinfo is one of the adjudicators, is Morne Morkel. "Thank you very much Pretoria," he says. "Things came together for me in Durban, and since then the rhythm has been great. I'm gland we held our nerve when Yusuf was going after us."

Man of the match is Hashim Amla. "Things went well, the pitch was challenging initially. But we did well, we and van Wyk. I am glad I managed to contribute handsomely in the decider. Up and down pitch, with turn and bounce, but good pitch overall. Extremely tight series, it was a nail-biter. Good preparation for the World Cup."

MS Dhoni: "Disappointing series for the batsmen. The bowlers were getting the wickets, and getting the runs too. It was a good pitch, but we kept losing wickets. Most of us got out playing shots. Yusuf can clear most cricket fields in the world. The big learning from this game is to keep wickets in hand for the last ten overs. Conditions at the WC will be very different, but the series gave a chance to test our young batsmen. The spectators have been spectacular through the tour."

India got a lot closer than they should have today, after a really shoddy show with ball and then with bat. One man made it possible - brace yourself for several such blinders from Yusuf Pathan. He now has two 100s from mind-blowing 100s from the lower middle-order. And stop the scepticism - he can play the short ball.

Great result in the end for SA, after being 1-2 down following two of the most demoralising defeats ever. They can only get better when Kalis returns, but we need to see if Steyn and Morkel can be this effective in the subcontinent.

India's batting line-up for the World Cup will look like this - Sehwag, Tendulkar, Gambhir, Kohli / Raina, Yuvraj, Dhoni and Yusuf. Bowling line-ups around the world will shudder when they look at that list. India need Dhoni and Yuvraj to find form, and the top three to find fitness though.

again on middle and leg, Zaheer comes across to try and work to the leg side, but can't get the single
tossed up on leg, Munaf paddles away with the top hand and gets a single.
defends a straight ball down the track. SA have only two overs from Steyn-Morkel left today.

fast and furious from Steyn, 147 kph and aimed at the stumps, Munaf backs away and plays it to covers
full and just outside off, Zaheer looks to steer and misses.

commentTextItems.html: Incredibly, this match is still not over. Zaheer pulls superbly, great timing and great placement between Botha running back from mid on and Botha from mid on. Both of them pile up as they slide into the boundary, but the ball beats them to it
back of a length outside off, Zaheer fends it with an opened face to short third man.
Munaf keeps his cool once again, backs away and steers behind point for another single
short ball, Zaheer backs away and times the pull well, but Lopsy has protection at deep midwicket
Munaf turns the strike over now. Backs away to a short ball and fends it to the leg side. They run across in a hurry for one

dismissalText.commentary: Graeme Smith c Pathan b Khan 7 (11b 1x4 0x6 10m) SR: 63.63

dismissalComment.html: Yawn. Zaheer gets Smith. On a length outside off, perfect length from Zaheer. Smith - as has been the case so many times this summer - is not sure whether he should play back, or play forward. Or even play at it. He ends up hanging the bat outside the off stump without much conviction after getting half forward and gets a healthy edge that is heading to first slip. Until Yusuf at second slip moves quickly to his right and pouches it almost in front of Rohit's face at first.

dismissalText.commentary: Morne van Wyk c & b Yuvraj Singh 56 (63b 8x4 0x6 72m) SR: 88.88

dismissalComment.html: Yuvraj plucks an apple out of nowhere! The best part of the catch was how easy he made it look. Tossed up on off stump, van Wyk packs a punch in his straight drive, and thinks he can get it easily down the ground. Yuvraj seemed to say, "Talk to the hand". Left hand to be specific. He just puts the left hand out and holds a ball that was traveling at some pace. Easy does it.

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers st †Dhoni b Yuvraj Singh 11 (12b 1x4 0x6 14m) SR: 91.66

dismissalComment.html: Yuvraj has made AB look rather ordinary with a lovely bit of spin. It's the same thing that happened in the previous game, though then, AB was wrongly given caught behind as he lunged out. This time he is comprehensively stumped,. Slow through the air, dipping on middle and leg, and breaking away menacingly. AB was lulled into skipping down the track, fooled by the flight, and was then groping in hope as it turned past him. Dhoni had a year to break the stumps.

dismissalText.commentary: Johan Botha c †Dhoni b MM Patel 2 (2b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: Munaf is throwing a humongous spanner in South Africa's works here. Another wicket goes down and this is exceptionally smart bowling. Barring the one ball that JP drove through the covers, there's been nothing to drive. This was another delivery back of a length in line with the stumps and Botha had to manufacture a shot. He looked to get forward, and then tried to force the pull, despite not having the room or the length for the shot. He got a top-edge, and Dhoni ran back to collect it.

dismissalText.commentary: Dale Steyn run out (†Dhoni) 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Steyn is run out. He chips out of the crease, making room on the off side as he does. Zaheer sees him and follows him, leaving Steyn with no room to play it to the off side. It is through him and Dhoni collects. Steyn tries to steal a single and turn the strike over to Amla, before realising there is no chance for a run. Dhoni runs towards the stumps and throws them down. Five down since resumption.

dismissalText.commentary: Morne van Wyk c & b Yuvraj Singh 56 (63b 8x4 0x6 72m) SR: 88.88

dismissalComment.html: Yuvraj plucks an apple out of nowhere! The best part of the catch was how easy he made it look. Tossed up on off stump, van Wyk packs a punch in his straight drive, and thinks he can get it easily down the ground. Yuvraj seemed to say, "Talk to the hand". Left hand to be specific. He just puts the left hand out and holds a ball that was traveling at some pace. Easy does it.

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers st †Dhoni b Yuvraj Singh 11 (12b 1x4 0x6 14m) SR: 91.66

dismissalComment.html: Yuvraj has made AB look rather ordinary with a lovely bit of spin. It's the same thing that happened in the previous game, though then, AB was wrongly given caught behind as he lunged out. This time he is comprehensively stumped,. Slow through the air, dipping on middle and leg, and breaking away menacingly. AB was lulled into skipping down the track, fooled by the flight, and was then groping in hope as it turned past him. Dhoni had a year to break the stumps.

dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy c & b MM Patel 35 (44b 1x4 0x6 65m) SR: 79.54

dismissalComment.html: and gone. Munaf hits back. He holds the length back and keeps it on off stump, JP looks to pull and skies a top edge. Munaf recovers well on his follow through, moves to the left of the pitch around the non-striker's end and takes the catch.

dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis b MM Patel 8 (6b 1x4 0x6 7m) SR: 133.33

dismissalComment.html: Faf has been Munaf-ed. Adjusts his line, knowing that Faf will look for the off side again, ramrod straight, without drifting on to the pads. Faf charged out, but could not have played any proper shot to that one. He's tried to work it to the off side, but the ball slips past at 135.5 kph and middle stump is out of the ground.

headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Johan Botha c †Dhoni b MM Patel 2 (2b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: Munaf is throwing a humongous spanner in South Africa's works here. Another wicket goes down and this is exceptionally smart bowling. Barring the one ball that JP drove through the covers, there's been nothing to drive. This was another delivery back of a length in line with the stumps and Botha had to manufacture a shot. He looked to get forward, and then tried to force the pull, despite not having the room or the length for the shot. He got a top-edge, and Dhoni ran back to collect it.

dismissalText.commentary: Robin Peterson b Khan 4 (2b 1x4 0x6 4m) SR: 200

dismissalComment.html: and India have another one in the end overs. Zaheer delivers the inch-perfect yorker from over the stumps. It was always headed for the base of off stump. Robin backed away, made room and looked to squeeze it away through the off side, but there was no stopping this one. Off stump goes for a walk.

dismissalText.commentary: Dale Steyn run out (†Dhoni) 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Steyn is run out. He chips out of the crease, making room on the off side as he does. Zaheer sees him and follows him, leaving Steyn with no room to play it to the off side. It is through him and Dhoni collects. Steyn tries to steal a single and turn the strike over to Amla, before realising there is no chance for a run. Dhoni runs towards the stumps and throws them down. Five down since resumption.

dismissalText.commentary: Morne Morkel run out (†Dhoni) 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: South Africa have lost the plot. And don't even seem to know it. Morne misses another yorker outside off, and then runs out of his crease mindlessly. Dhoni collects again and throws the stumps down. You miss, you run, I hit - seems to be the routine.

dismissalText.commentary: Parthiv Patel c du Plessis b Morkel 38 (34b 6x4 0x6 52m) SR: 111.76

dismissalComment.html: du Plessis seems to have taken a very good catch at covers. But they are checking upstairs. This could be interesting. Here's what happened: Driving length again from Morne, Parthiv gives it the treatment with another cover drive, but this time it is slightly airy. Faf at cover dives across to his left, tries to take it with both hands, with the right hand over the left. As he lands, the left hand comes off after he pouched it, and his right hand took full control of the ball. Did the ball touch the ground as he landed? Replays seem a little dicey - he did have two fingers under the ball in the end. The third umpire gives it out. Parthiv's blinder comes to an end.

dismissalText.commentary: Rohit Sharma b Tsotsobe 5 (8b 1x4 0x6 15m) SR: 62.5

dismissalComment.html: And Rohit falls. Frustrating, as he has been through this series. Lopsy angles another one across him and Rohit goes for another expansive cover drive. Unlike the previous shot, he does not move his feet across. The result - a thick inside edge that crashes into the stumps.

dismissalText.commentary: Virat Kohli c †de Villiers b Morkel 2 (6b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: A rare failure for Virat Kohli. Morne does him with sheer pace. Back of a length and extra bounce from outside off, Kohli committed to the check-drive into the covers early. On second thoughts, he may have wanted to leave it. It is through him in a jiffy, taking the outside edge through to the keeper

dismissalText.commentary: MS Dhoni c Smith b Morkel 5 (10b 1x4 0x6 11m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: India have lost a huge wicket. The scorecard will say edged and caught at slip, but this was not an outside edge in the true sense of the word. It was short, fractionally outside off and Dhoni went for the cut. He was a little late on the shot, and it wasn't wide enough for the cut. Plus it bounced more than he anticipated. Hence the edge, it was dying on first slip who took it well. India are reeling here.

dismissalText.commentary: Yuvraj Singh c Duminy b Steyn 8 (14b 2x4 0x6 18m) SR: 57.14

dismissalComment.html: Yuvraj plays one of the most ordinary shots you will see. Short, slower ball at 120 kph, lifting at him outside off, no room for the cut and Yuvraj goes at it with a half-hearted half-cut, half-steer nothing shot and guides it straight to point. It wasn't timed well enough to rush past the fielder, or placed wide enough to beat him. India's challenge is coming to an end.

dismissalText.commentary: Suresh Raina c Morkel b Steyn 11 (8b 2x4 0x6 15m) SR: 137.5

dismissalComment.html: Oh, Raina. Another wicket gifted. Raina looks to upper cut over third man now. That was lifting outside off, and there was a deep third man in place. Raina couldn't have found the fielder with more precision if he was aiming for him. Well, at this rate, India might be bowled out before 20 overs. And yes, that will constitute a match!

headshotImage.longCaption: F du Plessis headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Yusuf Pathan c du Plessis b Morkel 105 (70b 8x4 8x6 104m) SR: 150

dismissalComment.html: and it's over. Well. It was too good to last. Yusuf looks to rocket-launch it down the ground. And for once, he did not middle it. I think he got it low on the bat and scooped it straight up. Faf gets under the skier. Fittingly, Morne has got the wicket, which I think should clinch the game for SA. Yusuf knew it as soon as he made contact. He was in agony the moment the ball wen up. He was livid before it came down. He was in despair when it was caught. Never mind it, he is a hero.

dismissalComment.html: Harbhajan perishes. Another soft dismissal to a nothing shot. Tossed up on middle and leg and he chips it straight to midwicket in the circle. SA are five balls away from getting their hands on the prize. India can still make the early evening flight back home. Even South Africa can't choke from here.

dismissalText.commentary: Zaheer Khan c Morkel b Tsotsobe 24 (58b 3x4 0x6 81m) SR: 41.37

dismissalComment.html: Could not have been more fitting. Morne Morkel has the last touch on the ball as the series closes. 3-2 to South Africa, who were the better team through the series. Back of a length from Lopsy, Zaheer tries to crack it over the off side, hits it too high and Morne gets under it as he runs to his left from long off.

Here's what happened: Driving length again from Morne, Parthiv gives it the treatment with another cover drive, but this time it is slightly airy. Faf at cover dives across to his left, tries to take it with both hands, with the right hand over the left. As he lands, the left hand comes off after he pouched it, and his right hand took full control of the ball. Did the ball touch the ground as he landed? Replays seem a little dicey - he did have two fingers under the ball in the end. The third umpire gives it out. Parthiv's blinder comes to an end.

dismissalText.commentary: Yuvraj Singh c Duminy b Steyn 8 (14b 2x4 0x6 18m) SR: 57.14

dismissalComment.html: Yuvraj plays one of the most ordinary shots you will see. Short, slower ball at 120 kph, lifting at him outside off, no room for the cut and Yuvraj goes at it with a half-hearted half-cut, half-steer nothing shot and guides it straight to point. It wasn't timed well enough to rush past the fielder, or placed wide enough to beat him. India's challenge is coming to an end.

dismissalText.commentary: Suresh Raina c Morkel b Steyn 11 (8b 2x4 0x6 15m) SR: 137.5

dismissalComment.html: Oh, Raina. Another wicket gifted. Raina looks to upper cut over third man now. That was lifting outside off, and there was a deep third man in place. Raina couldn't have found the fielder with more precision if he was aiming for him. Well, at this rate, India might be bowled out before 20 overs. And yes, that will constitute a match!

dismissalText.commentary: Harbhajan Singh c Duminy b Botha 13 (16b 0x4 1x6 23m) SR: 81.25

dismissalComment.html: Harbhajan perishes. Another soft dismissal to a nothing shot. Tossed up on middle and leg and he chips it straight to midwicket in the circle. SA are five balls away from getting their hands on the prize. India can still make the early evening flight back home. Even South Africa can't choke from here.

dismissalText.commentary: Piyush Chawla b Peterson 8 (11b 1x4 0x6 12m) SR: 72.72

dismissalComment.html: Piyush was supposed to make the tail shorter. Well, he has contributed seven runs to the cause. Robin has turned one in sharply, past his forward defensive prod and off bail falls off. India are eight down.

headshotImage.caption: F du Plessis headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: F du Plessis headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Yusuf Pathan c du Plessis b Morkel 105 (70b 8x4 8x6 104m) SR: 150

dismissalComment.html: and it's over. Well. It was too good to last. Yusuf looks to rocket-launch it down the ground. And for once, he did not middle it. I think he got it low on the bat and scooped it straight up. Faf gets under the skier. Fittingly, Morne has got the wicket, which I think should clinch the game for SA. Yusuf knew it as soon as he made contact. He was in agony the moment the ball wen up. He was livid before it came down. He was in despair when it was caught. Never mind it, he is a hero.

dismissalText.commentary: Zaheer Khan c Morkel b Tsotsobe 24 (58b 3x4 0x6 81m) SR: 41.37

dismissalComment.html: Could not have been more fitting. Morne Morkel has the last touch on the ball as the series closes. 3-2 to South Africa, who were the better team through the series. Back of a length from Lopsy, Zaheer tries to crack it over the off side, hits it too high and Morne gets under it as he runs to his left from long off.
